results.title: Follow the fleet
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Mark Sandrich
results.brief_description: Based on Hubert Osborne’s play “Shore leave”, this romantic comedy musical features that wonderful dancing duo, Fred Astaire as Bake Baker, a sailor, and Ginger Rogers as Sherry Martin, a dance-hall hostess. Although playing more of a supportive role to Randolph Scott and Harriet Hilliard, the Fred and Ginger team put in an unforgettable performance with “Let’s face the music and dance”. Cast also includes Betty Grable and Lucille Ball. Lyrics and music by Irving Berlin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Mark Sandrich

results.title: Follow that camel
results.creator_credit: Peter Rogers Productions, Peter Rogers and Gerald Thomas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
England, 1906, and all is not cricket. After being tricked and humiliated at a high society club during a cricket match, Bertram West aka Beau (Jim Dale), now disgraced, leaves with batsman Simpson (Peter Butterworth) to join the Foreign Legion to prove his worth. Hot on Beau’s tail is the regretful Lady Jane Ponsonby (Angela Douglas) who travels to restore his reputation whilst losing her own. The usual Carry On crew are joined by Phil Silvers who reprises the Sergeant Bilko character in his role as Sergeant Knocker. A strong performance but distracting from the usual Carry On style. A few saucy surprises along the way, like Anita Harris who, usually type-cast as the wholesome girl next door, plays the shock role (for it’s time), of the erotic belly dancer. Cast includes: Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims and Bernard Bresslaw.

results.title: Follow that bird
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tony Garnett and Ken Kwapis
results.brief_description: Big Bird goes to stay with the Dodo family in Illinois, but soon realizes he really belongs with the variety of inhabitants on Sesame Street. Adapted from the very popular children’s television series, “Sesame Street”, this wonderful muppet film features Oscar, Bert, Ernie, Cookie Monster and many of the other loved characters from the television show. Delightful entertainment for all the family. Stars Chevy Chase, Sandra Bernhard, Waylon Jennings, Dave Thomas and John Candy in cameo roles and the voices of Carroll Spinney, Jim Henson, Frank Oz, Paul Bartel and others.

results.title: Follow my leader
results.brief_description: A Girl Guide Company requires a new leader. No-one is available so the Company carries on as best it can. Finally the Guides erect notices promoting a display of what they do and before too long they get a volunteer for a new leader and also new recruits.

results.title: Folk song fantasy
results.brief_description: Animated puppets and paper cut-outs enact the narratives contained in three folk songs sung by Emma Caslor: “THE RIDDLE SONG”, “WHO KILLED COCK ROBIN ?”, and “THE COOPER OF FIFE”. Animation by Alma Duncan; photography by Lyle Enright.

results.title: Folk dancing is fun
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, John Kingsford-Smith and Evelyn McCloughan
results.brief_description: Illustrates the important part folk dancing can play in primary education. Shows the teaching of folk dancing in simple movements to young children, and a series of more complicated Latvian and French dances suitable for older children. Demonstrates how actual dancing can lead to activities such as class projects on national folk dances, costumes and music, and how this interest can lead to international understanding and correct social behaviour at an early stage. The film concludes with a school folk dancing festival complete with national costumes made by the children. Music by Barbara Mettam.

results.title: Folk dances today
results.creator_credit: F A Film Associates and Mario Casetto
results.brief_description: At a teenagers’ dance party it is the “in” thing to do Greek and Armenian line dances, the Swedish “hambo”, middle eastern “debkas”, and Bulgarian “kolos”. The film cuts away to show each ethnic dance, or type, performed by exhibition groups with authentic styling in national costumes.

results.title: Folk dances
results.brief_description: An attractively set series of folk-dances, performed by dancers in authentic costumes, dancing to local folk-tunes. The dances include: the Moldavanetz, a Moldavian dance; the Krezhachek, a dance of Belo-Russia; and the Kazaki, a dance of Azerbijzhan. Music only.

results.title: Folk art: the Diana Brandt way
results.brief_description: Nationally renowned folk artist Diana Brandt brings her expertise, handy hints and experience to help you create traditional Bavarian Folk Art for your home. The equipment needed to complete two projects is shown and explained. The three strokes that comprise folk art are demonstrated clearly, simply and step-by-step so that you may practice to perfection at your own pace in your home. Includes scores of hints and shortcuts. Project One is a beautiful oval storage box with a delightfully rustic antique flower arrangement painted on the cover. Project Two is a teapot stand with a simple baroque design.
